entries.title: Apple hikes the price of iPhone battery replacements by $20
entries.description: Out-of-warranty iPhone owners will soon have to spend more to replace their batteries at an Apple store, Apple said this week.

entries.title: Apple and Amazon lost a 'staggering' $800 billion in market cap in 2022. Here's what that looks like
entries.description: The value of the two companies' losses dwarf other well-known tech names.

entries.title: Regulators warn U.S. banks on crypto risks including 'fraud and scams’ after FTX collapse
entries.description: Bank executives have said they need further guidance from regulators before dealing more directly with bitcoin and other types of cryptocurrency.

entries.title: As investors shift focus from inflation to growth, Club stocks with China exposure stand to gain
entries.description: As Beijing rolls back restrictions, the Chinese economy has nowhere to go but up. And Club names operating in China should see a boost.

entries.title: Feds launch FTX task force to recover victim assets, continue probes as Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty
entries.description: The collapse of crypto exchange FTX led to criminal prosecutions of founder Sam Bankman-Fried and two of his lieutenants in New York federal court.

entries.title: Some supply chain managers are wary of shifting trade back to West Coast ports
entries.description: CNBC's supply chain survey shows logistics managers are concerned about major issues at West Coast ports.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty to federal fraud charges in New York
entries.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried pleaded not guilty to fraud charges in a crypto case built with the cooperation of his lieutenants Caroline Ellison and Gary Wang

entries.title: Apple's market cap falls under $2 trillion as sell-off continues
entries.description: Apple first hit a $2 trillion valuation in August 2020, as the pandemic boosted its sales of computers to work or study from home.

entries.title: Tesla shares tumble more than 10% following deliveries report
entries.description: Some Wall Street analysts think Tesla's delivery numbers spell trouble for the electric vehicle maker. Others see a buying opportunity for the company in 2023.

entries.title: Gemini's Winklevoss accuses crypto mogul Silbert of 'bad faith stalling tactics' over frozen funds
entries.description: Gemini is attempting to recoup $900 million of client funds which it lent to Genesis to generate yields for its interest-bearing Gemini Earn accounts.

entries.title: Dubai nixes its 30% alcohol tax in a bid to attract more tourism
entries.description: The news was cheered by many residents; booze is notoriously pricey in Dubai, with a pint of beer often costing $15 and a glass of wine often $20 or more.

entries.title: Japanese families reportedly set to receive 1 million yen per child for moving out of Tokyo
entries.description: The Japanese government will give families up to 1 million yen ($7,670) per child if they opt to move out of Tokyo, according to multiple media reports.

entries.title: Gold surges to 6-month high, and analysts expect new records in 2023
entries.description: The price of gold notched a six-month high early on Tuesday, and analysts believe the rally has further to go in 2023.

entries.title: Five Chinese startups that survived a tough year of Covid lockdowns
entries.description: In a year of stringent Covid controls, some Chinese startups that survived found growth online and overseas.

entries.title: SpaceX raising $750 million at a $137 billion valuation, investors include Andreessen-Horowitz
entries.description: Last year, SpaceX achieved several new milestones but faced further delays to its Starship program.
